intro: Chailletia chlorina, commonly known as the green chailletia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Chailletia chlorina is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cooler, high-altitude environments. Its botanical features make it a unique and relatively rare species within its native habitat.
